option.description: Runtime action that must be specified in any command line and the action name (the values of this parameter) has to be registered in one of the configuration files (from runtime instance or server instance)
AREasy server host name
AREasy server TCP/IP port
AR System server name or IP address for direct connectivity
AR System user name
User password and value could be plain text of obfuscated (encrypted)
RPC channel port
TCP/IP port
Connectivity mode: base or overlay
Sets the priority of the action execution channel. All possible values could be: min (low priority), max (high priority), norm (normal priority)
Sets logging level of the current action execution session: debug, info, warn or error
Sets log format of the current action execution session
It sends the data array from server to the AREasy client as a one data line (all values are concatenated in one line, separated by space character).

Overwrites the standard configuration used to send the output data and the log messages via email. The recipients and all the other email details are specified in the configuration files or could be overwritten by the other parameters (see below). The notification body always will contain the data array generated by the action execution and the action log message. In case of you want to include only data or only the log message use -reportnodata and -reportnolog parameters (see below)
Ignores in the output message or in the notification body the data array generated by the action execution
Avoids appending to the output message or to the notification body the log messages generated by the action execution
Launches the action on the server side and don't wait server answer. This parameter works only in client/server mode
Displays action's help text. In case of other action than 'help' will use this option, instead of execute the action the runtime will return the help text of that action

Specifies if the help text to be generated from a specific level: 0 means only direct options, 1 include also additional options regarding action connectivity and environment, 2 will display also the options that maybe are not relevant for your action but provides all possible option ffrom connectivity and environment point of view
Prints out the help document containing all options related to the action that is called
Prints out the help document containing all samples related to the action that is called

Mailbox name from AR System Email Configuration. It overwrites notification details from AReasy configuration file regarding the mailbox name that will be used (defined in Remedy) to send the notification. So, this parameter could be used only if parameter -notification is specified
TO Email address name(s). It overwrites the corresponding notification property from configuration file
CC Email address name(s). It overwrites the corresponding notification property from configuration file
Email Subject notification. It overwrites the corresponding notification property from configuration file
Submitted notification status (by default is 'Yes', waiting for Remedy server to deliver submitted notification)
Remote AR System server name or IP address referred by AREasy instance
Remote AR System user name
Password for Remote user
RPC channel port for Remote server
TCP/IP port for Remote server
Remote connectivity mode: base or overlay
